fields.question: According to the reading, what makes insects and birds alike?
The reading mainly talks about:
fields.choice_1: Insects in comparison to other flying animals

fields.question: Which of the ff. groups of species are mentioned in the passage?
fields.choice_2: borers, bats, grubs, mosquito, butterflies, wasps
fields.choice_3: snails, borers, mosquito, butterflies, moths, worms

fields.question: According to the passage, what body part of an insect resembles a feather?

Read the following statements:

I.	The body of an insect is divided into a head, thorax and abdomen.
II.	Young insects do not always look like their parents.
III.	The wings of an insect are usually thin and transparent that’s why they are not called “true” wings.
IV.	Old wasps have a “hard type” body wall.

Which of the ff. is true?
fields.choice_1: Statements I & II are true, Statements III and IV are false
fields.choice_2: One of the statements is false
fields.choice_3: Statements I, II, III, IV are true

fields.question: How are ants and bees similar?
fields.choice_1: They both live in colonies consisting of workers, drones, and a queen.
fields.choice_2: The females or drones appear at swarming time.
fields.choice_3: The workers are of the same castes.

fields.question: How are ants and bees different?
fields.choice_1: The ants are more intelligent than the bees.
fields.choice_2: The bees are more intelligent than the ants.
fields.choice_3: They have the same level of intelligence.

fields.question: Which of the following statements are true?
fields.choice_1: There are ants which live as hunters and some as shepherds.
fields.choice_2: There are ants which grow crops either in or near the nest.

fields.question:
Which of the following statements are false?
1.	Some ants are considered of value to man.
2.	Some ants are source of great annoyance and injury.
3.	None of the above.
fields.choice_1: Some ants are considered of value to man.
fields.choice_2: Some ants are source of great annoyance and injury.

fields.question: Which of the following statements are true?
fields.choice_1: Ants are as numerous as the stars in the skies and they vary in size.
fields.choice_2: They are found from the tropics to the frozen north, in deserts, swamps and in fact, almost any place where plants or animals live.

fields.question:
Why are the ants called the rulers of the world?

Statement I.	They can feed on almost every imaginable kind of plant and animal material. 
Statement II.	When the food is scarce, they do not waste time building or manufacturing a complicated nest, they simply "pack up" and migrate.
The speaker asserts that:
fields.choice_4: Old people should take it easy and sleep early at night
fields.choice_1: People at the ends of their lives should cherish every moment while still alive and should not have regrets when they die
fields.choice_2: People at the ends of their lives should be contented and accept death when it comes
fields.choice_3: People at the ends of their lives should strongly resist death

fields.question:
In the poem, the phrase “dying of the light” means:
A.	Old Age
B.	Death (O)
C.	Sunset
D.	Past
Which of the following lines demonstrate alliteration?
fields.choice_4: And you, my father, there on that sad height,
fields.choice_1: Because their words had forked no lightning they
fields.choice_2: Good men, the last wave by, crying how bright,
fields.choice_3: Blind eyes could blaze like meteors and be gay,

fields.question: Which of these men shout out how great their actions would've been if they'd been allowed to live longer?

5.	Which of the following statements are correct?

I.	The speaker is dying.
II.	The speaker’s father is dying.
III.	The speaker is trying to fight his own death.
IV.	The speaker is telling his father to fight death.
V.	The speaker doesn't want to accept the idea that he’s getting old like his father.
VI.	The speaker doesn't want to accept the idea that his father is getting old.
fields.choice_1: Statements I and III are true.
fields.choice_2: Statements II and IV are true.

fields.question:
Which of the following statements is true?

A. Children make sophisticated method of collecting insects.

B. Children have little time or inclination to use apparatus in collecting insects.
What are the common ways of collecting insects that children do?
fields.choice_1: Using an old straw hat or a limb.

fields.question: What are some ways of killing insects that children do?
fields.choice_2: Pressing the body of soft insects with fingers.
fields.choice_3: Putting them in a killing bottle with some deadly material.

fields.question:
Which of the statements are true?

A. Bees and wasps can be quickly killed by dropping them in coal oil or strong soap suds.

B. Insects can be quickly killed by putting them inside a bottle with poison, chloroform or ether.
Which of the following are soft insects?
According to the reading, what are the kind of materials that can quickly kill insects?
Which of the following does not belong to the principal classes of subjects of Chinese paintings?

How does the Chinese Painting differ from the European painting?
The Chinese painting does not include human figure.
The European painting does not include human figure.
The Chinese painting does not have a predominant place assigned to the painting of the human figure.
fields.choice_4: The European painting does not have a predominant place assigned to the painting of the human figure.
fields.choice_5: There's no difference between the two.
fields.choice_1: The Chinese painting does not include human figure.
fields.choice_2: The European painting does not include human figure.
fields.choice_3: The Chinese painting does not have a predominant place assigned to the painting of the human figure.

fields.question:
What does “landscape” mean in Chinese painting?
Mountain and water picture
Conception of Creation
Earth and water
Which of the following does not fall under the Third Class?
In some books, what subdivision is included in the fourth class, Plants and Insects?
In what class of painting does Buddhist painting fall under in Chinese paintings?
Which two principles are considered by the Chinese as the source of the universe?
How was the tiger described as symbol of earthly principle?
fields.choice_1: He challenges the furies of nature that are hostile to the expression of the divine soul.
fields.choice_2: His ferocious form lurks in the tempest.
fields.choice_3: He defies tornadoes which bends the bamboos and uproots trees

fields.question: What is an example of perfect harmonious combination of the two principles of yang and yin that symbolizes virginal purity?
What religion/belief does not believe in the reality of the world – that forms are but transitory, the universe an illusion forever flowing into an unending future?
How is freedom from perpetual transmigration attained?
fields.choice_3: Be susceptible to pain and death

fields.question: Which of these groups of species can be accepted as descendants of dragons?
Lines 1,6,12,18 and 3,9,15,19 of the poem are refrain. It suggests that this poem is an example of a ________.
Do not Go Gentle into That Good Night" is an elegy because it:
According to the reading, the "last judgment" will take place in ________.
In what year was the end of the world (Apocalypse) prophesied to be?
Which of the following are supposed to be signs that the end of the world is near?
What was previously believed to be the sign of speedy dissolution of the world?
How is the answer in No. 4 regarded in the modern age?
fields.choice_4: Sign that Satan is about to overtake the world.
fields.choice_1: Agent of destruction of the world.
fields.choice_2: Sign of bad luck for any undertaking or concluding any business.
fields.choice_3: Sign of coming of a great plague.

fields.question: What periods do men have strong beliefs toward prophecies?
When magnified, the eyes of an insect looks like what?
The methods of singing have been based in what branches of science?
Why are singers afraid of the physiology of the vocal organs?
fields.choice_1: Because they do not clearly understand the limits of its teachings.
fields.choice_2: Because they think it is useless to learn it.
fields.choice_3: Because they do not know their own vocal organs.

fields.question: What kind of physiological activities can help singers improve their vocals?
fields.choice_1: Drawing up the soft palate against the hard palate.
fields.choice_2: Placing tongue in many different positions.
fields.choice_3: Placing larynx at the low position and by that of the vowel in a high one.

fields.question: Which of the following statements is true?
fields.choice_1: Physiology is concerned also with muscles, nerves, sinews, ligaments, and cartilage, all of which are used in singing, but all of which we cannot feel.
fields.choice_2: Physiology is concerned also with muscles, nerves, sinews, ligaments, and cartilage, all of which are used in singing, but all of which we can feel.
fields.choice_3: Physiology is concerned also with muscles, nerves, sinews, ligaments, and cartilage, none of which are used in singing, and all of which we cannot feel.

fields.question:
Which of the following exercises should not be practiced?
Students of singing should use the early morning hours for singing.
Students of singing should sing every day only so much (like an hour), that on the next day they can practice again, feeling fresh.
Students of singing should practice singing ten today and none tomorrow.
fields.choice_1: Students of singing should use the early morning hours for singing.
fields.choice_2: Students of singing should sing every day only so much (like an hour), that on the next day they can practice again, feeling fresh.
fields.choice_3: Students of singing should practice singing ten today and none tomorrow.

fields.question: Which of the following statements is not true?
fields.choice_2: Practicing proper singing exercises regularly is good for the vocal organs.
fields.choice_3: Vocal exercises refresh and improve power of endurance is vocal organs.

fields.question: Who said the famous declaration "that long hair was a shame unto a man"?

Which of the following statements is not true?
The fashion of the hair and cut of the beard have been state questions in France and England, from the establishment of Christianity until the fifteenth century.
In earlier times, men were not permitted to do as they liked with their own hair. 
The beards for the soldiers are a disadvantage as they afforded convenient handles for the enemy to lay hold of, preparatory to cutting off their heads.
None of the above.
fields.choice_1: The fashion of the hair and cut of the beard have been state questions in France and England, from the establishment of Christianity until the fifteenth century.
fields.choice_2: In earlier times, men were not permitted to do as they liked with their own hair.
fields.choice_3: The beards for the soldiers are a disadvantage as they afforded convenient handles for the enemy to lay hold of, preparatory to cutting off their heads.

fields.question: Who ordered the whole of his army to be closely shaven to deprive them of the disadvantage in war?
Which of the following statements is not true?
fields.choice_1: At one time, long hair was the symbol of sovereignty in Europe.
fields.choice_2: It was a privilege of the royal family to have their hair long and curled.
fields.choice_3: The nobles, equal to kings in power, wore not only their hair, but their beards of an enormous length.

fields.question: Which of the following statements was decreed by the Pope towards the end of the eleventh century?
fields.choice_4: A man with long hair shall be stoned to death.
fields.choice_1: A man with long hair shall be regarded as highly immoral, criminal, and beastly.
fields.choice_2: Such persons as wore long hair should be excommunicated while living and not be prayed for when dead.
fields.choice_3: Whenever any body offending in this respect would receive blessing from a priest, a knife can be used to cut off a handful of the hair, throw them in his face and tell him to cut off all the rest.

fields.question: Who preached a sermon that drew so dreadful a picture of the torments that awaits people with long hair that several of audience burst into tears, and wrung their hair, as if they would have pulled it out by the roots?
